Happy Holidays from the GLR family!

No matter what the future holds, today we are feeling blessed for 2022 - for all the memories we carry with us into the New Year, for all the hard work, for all our artists and collaborators, for all our clients and collectors and for our GLR team! It takes a village and we are feeling grateful for ours 🙏

Experience the raw and powerful emotion of transformation through Yulia Bas’s captivating portraits. The Barcelona-based artist’s journey has come full circle as her work celebrates the beauty of imperfection, exploring the possibilities of how space, paint and pencil can reflect her ever-shifting identity.

@yulia__bas
.
.
.
.
#yuliabas  #galerieleroyer #glrtoronto #galerieleroyertoronto

HEROES OF OUR HERITAGE

The centre of Lviv, Ukraine, is home to historic sculptures and cultural heritage. 

In March of 2022, citizens were faced with the chaos that war entails, and despite the obvious dangers, they collectively protected the art and heritage of this historical site. 
 
Heroes of Our Heritage is a new artistic project by sculptors, Coderch & Malavia that comprises of three newly created works inspired by the brave citizens who rescued the sculptures by way of packaging and sandbags. “We want to value all the individual and collective actions that the Ukrainians carried out to protect the cultural heritage against the destruction of war.” - C&M

Art that pays homage, gets involved, and is committed to the cause. 

For these reasons and more, we will be donating a percentage of the sales of Heroes of Our Heritage to ICOMOS - an NGO associated with UNESCO for the conservation of monuments and cultural sites.
 
“On the horizon, a hope.
Dawn breaks. A light, a flash.
What brilliance
It is not a projectile of war,
it is the truth that in his soul
all await:
Peace".
- Marta Ruiz Jimenez.

@coderch.malavia.sculptors 

#glrcontemporary #galerieleroyer #ukraine #coderchandmalavia #heroesofourheritage

Capturing the tumultuous nature of modern life, Ali Alisir's artwork reflects a pursuit of peace amidst chaos. His hybrid bodies illustrate the equilibrium between conflict & resolution - a reflection of our own inner struggle to find balance in this ever-changing world.

This ongoing photographic series focuses on the collective experience of contemporary culture. By superimposing layers of human bodies, Alisir seeks to examine the societal realities that manifest in many different forms and through various fields, such as philosophy, sociology, literature, and cinema.

@alialisir

.

We’re taking a trip down memory lane! Yoakim Bélanger’s artwork focuses on the human form - through raw materials such as oxidized steel and aluminum, he celebrates its strength and grace while sublimating physical beauty and portraying both body and soul.  #GLROverTheYears

@yoakimbelanger

My new solo exhibition will open this week Thursday at @galerieleroyer in Montréal, Canada!

The exhibition titled "Floral Symphony" will feature over 18 brand new works from various styles along with my special flower floor installation where the complete gallery floor will be covered by my rice paper flowers ❤️

Shown here is a flowerbed of 140cm in diameter titled "Pink Horizon" that forms one of the highlight pieces of the exhibition -- see you there?

12 October, 2023
45 rue St-Paul Ouest
Montréal, QC H2Y 1Z1

#zhuanghongyi #art #artist #contemporaryart #artwork #flowerbed #canada #galerieleroyer #montreal

Step into a realm where fantasy and urban grit collide as the timeless artwork of Frank Frazetta meets the contemporary vibrance of Stikki Peaches. In this captivating fusion, Frazetta’s epic tales of warriors and mythical creatures intertwine with Peaches’ bold, street-inspired art. The result is a visually stunning narrative that transcends time and genre, offering a fresh perspective on the power of imagination and storytelling through the ages. Explore the unexpected connections between two distinct artistic worlds in a mesmerizing display of storytelling,  blending of different artistic realms, and visually impactful pieces. While their styles may differ, these common elements offer opportunities for collaboration and artistic synergy.

If you are in Miami come check out this tribute to the Godfather of Fantasy Art @miamiartfairs Context Booth #B12 from December 5th to the 10th curated by @galerieleroyer 

Special thanks to @sarafrazetta & @frazettagirls for allowing me to bring this collection to life. — @stikki_peaches 

#stikkipeaches #frankfrazetta #tribute #artshow #miami #artbasel #context #sarafrazetta #mixedmedia #galerieleroyer #montreal #embracethechaos

Building stories and themes through out my work is something I’ve always loved, if you’ve followed my art journey through the years you probably remember a few exhibitions immersing you into something more than just the art. If you are new here enjoy the ride. This one is a personal favourite. 

As a young teen in the late 1980’s, I was heavily into collectibles; mainly comic books, trading cards and poseable figurines - whatever I could afford to get my hands on. My obsession at the time was anything and everything Star Wars. To me, George Lucas was as “godlike” as can be, until I read an article from a vintage Heavy Metal magazine featuring the name Frank Frazetta as one of Lucas’ influences. From that day on, I became an instant fan of the man who they call “the godfather of fantasy art”. It all made sense to me; for years I gawked and marveled at the creations and mind of Lucas when, all along, I was subconsciously being fed bits and pieces of who would later be known as Frank Frazetta and his fantastic worlds. 

Fast forward 30+ years, a full circle moment in my life happened when connecting with Frazetta’s granddaughter, Sara Frazetta, an amazing artist herself and a key figure in keeping the legacy of her late grandfather alive. For the better part of two years of pitching ideas, granting me access to photos of her grandfather and grandmother, Ellie Frazetta, I created a capsule of works as a tribute to a master of his craft, who has influenced so many artists of all sorts with his signature style and originality, always sticking to his mantra of creating what he wanted to create and to not follow trends. I am forever grateful to @sarafrazetta and @frazettagirls for trusting my ideas and vision, and for their patience throughout the past two years in allowing me to bring these pieces to life, and to @galerieleroyer for the wonderful curation of this show entitled, “For the Birds”. 

🤘🏼💀 🦅 

On view @artmiamifairs Context Booth B12 from Dec 6th to the 10th. 

#stikkipeaches #frazettagirls #sarafrazetta #galerieleroyer #miami #context #artshow #homage #tribute #frankfrazetta #fantasyart #itellstories
